title: Translational kinetic energy - speed of hawk

content.question: A hawk with mass <math alttext="1 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo> </mo><mi>kg</mi></math> dives straight downward. At time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, the hawk has a speed of <math alttext="20 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>. At time <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, the hawk has a speed of <math alttext="50 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>50</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>/</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>. The change in the kinetic energy of the hawk between <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
